awd_abstract_narration: This project concerns the theory of discrete deterministic                 nonlinear control systems and their relationship to continuous                  time models.  The interest is both discrete time results as such                and on sampling and other discretization techniques, with an                    emphasis on certain subclasses such as invertible, polynomial and               piecewise linear systems.  The theory builds on past research by                the PI and others in these areas.  For invertible systems, it is                now possible to obtain Lie-algebraic accessibility conditions                   very analogous to those known for continuous time systems.  In                  polynomial case, elementary techniques from algebraic geometry                  become useful.  Regarding sampling, the main objective is the                   understanding of how properties of continuous time physical                     systems are preserved under digital control.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
